sport that has a long history. Archaeological records indicate that horse racing
occurred in ancient Greece, Babylon, Syria, and Egypt. [http://www.libraryindex.com/pages/2186/Animals-in-Sports-ROOTS-
ANIMAL-SPORTS.html Earliest record of horse racing] Both chariot and
mounted horse racing were events in the ancient Greek Olympics by 648
BC. [http://www.hellenism.com/olympics/ancientgames/equestrian.htm Ancient
Greek Olympic Horse Racing] In the Roman Empire, chariot and mounted horse
racing were major
industries. [http://forequestrians.com/Directory/racing/?C=5163 Horse racing
in Rome] Thoroughbred racing was, and is, popular with the aristocrats and
royalty of British society, earning it the title "Sport of Kings." Specogna,
Marino (2005) [http://books.google.com/books?id=TLMkMC-
KuxwC&pg=PA1&dq=horse+racing+sport+of+kings&hl=en&ei=7iBuTreIC4W18QOjt9UN&sa=X&-

sport%20of%20kings&f=false Become a Winner Claiming Thoroughbred Race Horses]
iUniverse, 2005. Retrieved 12 September 2011

The style of racing, the distances and the type of events vary significantly by
the country in which the race is occurring, and many countries offer different
types of horse races. There are three major types of racing: flat racing,
steeplechasing (racing over jumps), and harness racing, where horses trot or
pace while pulling a driver in a sulky. Edwards, The Encyclopedia of the
Horse, pp. 332â337 A major part of horse racing's economic importance lies
in the gambling associated with it, Campbell, National Gambling Impact Study
Commission Final Report, p. 111 an activity that in 2008 generated a world-
wide market worth around US$115 billion. [http-
://www.horseracingintfed.com/newsDisplay.asp?story=664 Global betting stable,
but some countries suffer recession]

Various types of racing have given rise to horse breeds that excel in the
specific disciplines of each sport. Breeds that may be used for flat racing
include the Thoroughbred, Quarter Horse, Arabian, Paint, and Appaloosa. [http://www.ushorse.biz/racing-race-
horses.htm Flat racing breeds] Steeplechasing breeds include the
Thoroughbred and AQPS. Harness racing is dominated by Standardbred horses in
Australia, New Zealand and North America, but several other breeds, such as the
Russian Trotter and Finnhorse, are seen in Europe.
